intro: Pariana inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal pariana, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed soils and open areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely domesticated.
